application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Construction of single-storey outbuilding with a basement level for ancillary workshop/office/storage use (following demolition of single-storey outbuilding).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with document/drawing references: 20982-SK01-Rev-B; 20982-SK02-Rev-A; 20982-SK03-Rev-B; Design, Access and Heritage Statement, prepared by Mark Reeves Architects, dated December 2020, Addendum added February 2021.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Control measures during the demolition and construction shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details, including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting, or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies D13, D14 and SI 1 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of development (including groundworks and site clearance), a Tree Protection Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Tree Protection measures shall be installed prior to the commencing of demolition works. They shall remain in place for the duration of demolition, and construction works are completed, including external works and removal of all equipment, machinery and surplus materials from the site.

Any trees, shrubs or hedges removed without consent, die, are severely damaged or become seriously diseased within five years from the completion of the approved development, shall be replaced with trees, shrubs or hedges capable of achieving comparable quantity and quality, within the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive), following the tree damage.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in accordance with Policy G7 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | A suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and pits shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the approved development. The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details:
- Full planting specification - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes from the original application proposals.
- Locations of all proposed species.
- Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
- Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
- Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root                barriers/deflectors) in the future
- Staking/tying method(s).

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following the first use of the approved development. The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive), with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree planting in accordance with Policy G7 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | The outbuilding shall only be used for domestic purposes ancillary to 2 Kenilworth Road and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, industrial or commercial use. No cooking, kitchen, or shower facilities shall be installed in the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD.

| The sound insulation of the building envelope and noise mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses, activities, machinery and plant are contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of Ealing Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014 and BS4142:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise-sensitive premises, including external amenity spaces. The sound mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the first use of the approved development and shall thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the surrounding homes' amenity is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D14 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The use of the approved outbuilding shall not commence until all external doors to the building have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition. At no time shall any external door or window (including skylights) be fixed in an open position to rooms where noise, odour, smoke, or fumes may be emitted.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the surrounding homes is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
